title: Islamic State leader killed by US: reports
text:
Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. | EPA/Islamic State Video Islamic State leader killed by US: reports Donald Trump is expected to make announcement later Sunday.

The leader of ISIS, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, is reported to have been killed during a U.S. raid in Syria.

The Associated Press cited a U.S. official confirming that an operation targeting the rebel leader, who has led ISIS for five years, had taken place in Idlib province in northwestern Syria.

U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted in the early hours of Sunday morning: “Something very big has just happened!”

Trump is expected to give a press conference at 9 a.m. local time. Meanwhile, Mazloum Abdi, the commander of the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, said on Twitter that a joint operation with U.S. forces had been carried out.

“Our sources from inside Syria have confirmed to the Iraqi intelligence team tasked with pursuing Baghdadi that he has been killed alongside his personal bodyguard in Idlib," an official from Iraq's security services told Reuters.

The development comes amid fears that the recent withdrawal of U.S. troops from Syria would lead to a resurgence in ISIS operations and destabilize the region.
description: Donald Trump is expected to make announcement later Sunday.
